subject: shall we meet ?
body:
thinking we should brainstorm a little around programming content for Women lift health?
e.g.   feminine ideals? legacy creation and sustaining? 
thinking we need to spend some time identifying critical topics/creating a straw model that we can ultimately do a deeper dive into topics like this? so we can have some more specific details on content to share with WLH when we are ready?  
or perhaps you are already doing this?
deb

subject: RE: BCW and CDW Receivables
body:
Let me know if you need any help resolving these issues! 
 
From:
 Grace Vottero <g.vottero@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, May 30, 2023 1:57 PM
To:
 Michelle Murcia <m.murcia@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com>; Sarah Nodarse <s.nodarse@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: BCW and CDW Receivables
Importance:
 High
 
Hi Michelle,
 
I will send a longer reply shortly, but please can you urgently inform CDW that they are 
not
 
being
 invoiced for the 2,000? This is a sensitive subject with that client, because LCW incorrectly invoiced them in the past for this amount. This was for work they 
never agreed to buy
, and we 
did not deliver
.
 
This was a mistake that our previous accounting team made – he invoiced the client without my consent, apparently this was due to a Scoro issue for a proposal they ultimately decided not to do. In Scoro, that quote never made its way to Signed. It was a BD Proposal and then should now show as cancelled. 
 
I know that our QuickBooks and Scoro don’t match exactly, so I am always happy to resolve these questions internally, before we send messages to our clients.
 
Thanks.
Grace
 
From:
 Michelle Murcia <
m.murcia@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, May 30, 2023 2:32 PM
To:
 Grace Vottero <
g.vottero@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Jennifer Barbieri <
j.barbieri@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 BCW and CDW Receivables
 
We are testing the quality of our past due receivables and as the attached are significantly past due, I am hoping you can provide an update.  I have reached out directly to the client, as well, but can you share any insight as to why they haven’t paid?
 
 
Michelle Murcia
Accounting, 
LCW 
Email: 
m.murcia@lcwmail.com
Mobile: +1.614.546.8422

subject: RE: WCUC panel outline
body:
Absolutely.  Alisa would like to see our fiscal responsibility and focus on supporting business development!
 
 
Andrea
------------------------------------------------------
Andrea Wicks Bowles
Senior Consultant (She/Her)
a.wicksbowles@lcwmail.com
LCW   New Jersey
773-938-4181
 
 
   
www
 
|
 
Twitter
 
|
 
Facebook
 
|
 
LinkedIn
 
From:
 Grace Vottero <g.vottero@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, May 31, 2023 11:27 AM
To:
 Andrea Wicks Bowles <a.wicksbowles@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 FW: WCUC panel outline
 
Hey! I wanted to share this and get your thoughts. I wonder if we can pivot to a virtual/hybrid session, because I think the travel to Vancouver will actually be too expensive…. Interested in brainstorming how to still turn this into an opportunity 
 
From:
 Eleni Giakoumopoulos <
EGiakoumopoulos@woccu.org
> 
Sent:
 Monday, May 29, 2023 3:51 PM
To:
 Grace Vottero <
g.vottero@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: WCUC panel outline
 
Hi Grace,
 
Hope you’re having a good holiday weekend. I’m very glad we had the chance to connect in DC earlier this month. Thank you to LCW for offering to be part of the GWLN Forum at 2023 WCUC. To move things along, please note the following regarding the panel session and what we discussed:
 
A proposed change to the session title could be  “Women Leading, DEI and Institutional Change”.  
I discussed it with our CEO and she is interested in being part of the panel. A suggestion is to look at a pragmatic approach in global organizations – how do you make change and institutionalize change in big and small country context, talk about how you’re dealing with complex biases that are cultural biases, share specific examples, etc. Please look at your session description and see if this can be woven into the session and your proposed questions or if the session objectives need to be changed at all.  
 
Attached is the agenda draft as it stands today with a changed session title.  
 
Please look at options on LCW’s calendar so we can get the panel on a call to discuss the session in the coming weeks. 
 
I am in Greece for personal reasons this week, but I will be checking emails. Let me know if you have questions.
Kind regards,
Lena  
 
 
 
Lena Giakoumopoulos
 
(She/Her)
 
• 
Director
egiakoumopoulos@woccu.org
1010 E Washington Ave, Suite 306 
• Madison WI 53703
+1 608-395-2031
cuwomen.org
 
 
 
 
From:
 Eleni Giakoumopoulos 
Sent:
 Wednesday, May 17, 2023 8:19 PM
To:
 Grace Vottero <
g.vottero@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: WCUC panel outline
 
Hi Grace,
 
I’m in DC and checked in if you can still meet this afternoon. I sent you a text so let me know.
Thanks. 
 
Lena Giakoumopoulos
 
(She/Her)
 
• 
Director
egiakoumopoulos@woccu.org

 Grace Vottero <
g.vottero@lcwmail.com

 Re: WCUC panel outline
 
Yes I will. I will text you once I’ve arrived although check in isn’t until 3. See you tomorrow. 
 
Get 
Outlook for iOS
From:
 Grace Vottero <
g.vottero@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Tuesday, May 16, 2023 5:21:48 PM
To:
 Eleni Giakoumopoulos <
EGiakoumopoulos@woccu.org
>
Subject:
 Re: WCUC panel outline
 
 
That absolutely works for me! You’ll be near the office in SE, right? Philz could be a good place to meet!
 
Grace Vottero
(she/her/hers)
Consultant
LCW 
100 S Saunders Rd, Suite 150
Lake Forest, IL 60045

From:
 Eleni Giakoumopoulos <
EGiakoumopoulos@woccu.org
>
Sent:
 Tuesday, May 16, 2023 3:04:42 PM
To:
 Grace Vottero <
g.vottero@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: WCUC panel outline
 
 
Hi Grace,
 
Thanks for your message. Will we be able to meet tomorrow afternoon in DC once I arrive to go over details? Does that still work for you?
 
 
With respect to costs, GWLN cannot cover any of your costs to be part of the GWLN panel (travel and accommodations). We also do not provide any type of speaking fee for our events at WCUC. 
 
However, I am confused by your message 
Our only limitation is that we have been instructed not to pay to speak in conferences -- but I think that's okay (let me know if I misunderstood)
.
 
Hope we can clarify tomorrow. Let me know.
Lena 
 
 
Lena Giakoumopoulos
 
(She/Her)
 
• 
Director
egiakoumopoulos@woccu.org
1010 E Washington Ave, Suite 306 
• Madison WI 53703
+1 608-395-2031
cuwomen.org
 
 
 
 
From:
 Grace Vottero <
g.vottero@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, May 16, 2023 10:05 AM
To:
 Eleni Giakoumopoulos <
EGiakoumopoulos@woccu.org
>
Subject:
 Re: WCUC panel outline
 
Lena! 
 
Thank you for patience with this slow reply; I've been on the road the last two days. 
 
I want to confirm that LCW would cover costs for hotel, flights, etc to be in Vancouver at the time of the panel. 
Our only limitation is that we have been instructed not to pay to speak in conferences -- but I think that's okay (let me know if I misunderstood)
 
Grace Vottero
(she/her/hers)
Consultant
From:
 Eleni Giakoumopoulos <
EGiakoumopoulos@woccu.org
>
Sent:
 Thursday, May 11, 2023 09:25
To:
 Grace Vottero <
g.vottero@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: WCUC panel outline 
 
Grace, 
 
Before we proceed, I want to make re-iterate that unfortunately GWLN cannot cover any costs for the three of you to come and participate in the GWLN Forum. 
 
Please confirm that LCW is in agreement. If that’s the case, then let’s do 5/17. 
 
I will be at The Thompson (221 Tingey St. SE, Washington, DC) near the 99 M street office. I’m sure you can recommend somewhere to meet near there. 
I can text you when I’m settled and you can pick a spot. 
 
Let me know if that works. Otherwise let’s do the 5/16 at 8 am CT. 
 
Thanks. 
 
 
Lena Giakoumopoulos
 
(She/Her)
 
• 
Director
egiakoumopoulos@woccu.org
1010 E Washington Ave, Suite 306 
• Madison WI 53703
+1 608-395-2031
cuwomen.org
 
 
 
 
From:
 Grace Vottero <
g.vottero@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Thursday, May 11, 2023 8:10 AM
To:
 Eleni Giakoumopoulos <
EGiakoumopoulos@woccu.org
>
Subject:
 RE: WCUC panel outline
 
Hi Lena,
 
That all sounds perfect! 
 
I will be in DC on the 17
th
 too! Should we discuss in person?! I can also make the other times work 
😊
 but would love to see you
 
Congratulations to you and your son!!! Enjoy the celebrations.
 
Talk soon!
Grace
 
From:
 Eleni Giakoumopoulos <
EGiakoumopoulos@woccu.org
> 
Sent:
 Thursday, May 11, 2023 9:08 AM
To:
 Grace Vottero <
g.vottero@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: WCUC panel outline
 
Hi Grace,
 
Hope you’re well and it really was great talking through the collaboration with the panel at WCUC. I’ve taken a look and haven’t gotten back to you because I’m meeting with the potential panelist late today. 
 
I wanted to see if she would be interested and then get back to you. I have a couple of questions on the proposal and in order to save time, let me know if you’re available any of these times for the follow up: 
 
5/15 at 3 pm CT 
5/16 at 8 am CT 
5/17 – I will be in DC and should be in the hotel from 1-3 pm ET
 
I’m out of the office tomorrow (son’s graduation). Have a good day.
Lena 
 
 
Lena Giakoumopoulos
 
(She/Her)
 
• 
Director
egiakoumopoulos@woccu.org
1010 E Washington Ave, Suite 306 
• Madison WI 53703
+1 608-395-2031
cuwomen.org
 
 
 
 
From:
 Grace Vottero <
g.vottero@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, May 3, 2023 1:29 PM
To:
 Eleni Giakoumopoulos <
EGiakoumopoulos@woccu.org
>
Subject:
 WCUC panel outline
 
Hi Lena, it was so lovely to talk to you last week! I have to confess: I’m wrestling with the FUN title for the session, but since everything else is ready, I’m sending as is. What do you think?! Let me know when you want to chat again next.
 
I was also thinking about our conversation about speaker diversity. I am not sure about feasibility or availability, but if WOCCU is still looking for a way to diversify keynote speakers and maybe have a Keynote Speaker sponsored by WOCCU, LCW’s Managing Partner/co-CEO Chuck Adams is a really strong and engaging keynote speaker.  I figure it is probably a bit late in the game for a new keynote speaker, but wanted to mention it.
 
Talk to you soon!
Grace
 
 
------------------------------------------------------
Grace Vottero
(she/her/hers)
Consultant,
 LCW
Email: 
g.vottero@lcwmail.com

subject: WFCU Events at WCUC 2023 in Vancouver!
body:
Worldwide Foundation for Credit Unions (WFCU) is hosting a variety of events at the 2023 World Credit Union Conference in Vancouver, Canada! 
This Weeks Highlighted Event: 
Give Back Activity
Tuesday, July 25th
3:30 p.m. to 6:00 p.m.
FREE to Conference Attendees!
Gather with your fellow WCUC attendees to give back and help clean up a local Vancouver shore-line. 
Ocean Wise Shoreline Cleanup
 is a citizen science program, dedicated to the collection of shoreline litter and litter data. Together they not only prevent the leak of plastic litter into our Ocean but more importantly collect valuable litter data that helps scientists, policy makers and businesses take meaningful action to prevent harmful plastic pollution. Join us for this event and all WFCU events in Vancouver listed below!  
WFCU
Gala @ Grouse Mountain
Global DE Social
Celebration of Light Cruise
Give Back Opportunity
GWLN
GWLN Reception
GWLN Forum
WYCUP
WYCUP Emerging Leaders' Summit
All proceeds of these WFCU events @ WCUC support our 
2023 Bridge the Gap Campaign
, helping credit unions and their members overcome global challenges.
 
 
A registered charity organization with
P.O. Box 2982 • Madison, WI 53701-2982 USA • 
Foundation@woccu.org
 • DoGlobalGood.org
Want to change how you receive these emails?
You can update your preferences or 
unsubscribe from this list
.
